text: Marie Watters Colton (October 20, 1922https://www.google.com/search?client=ms- android- samsung&biw;=412&bih;=342&tbm;=bks&ei;=5wGrW63XDcvSwAKIvKGgCg&q;=Marie+Watters+Colton+October+20%2C+1922&oq;=Marie+Watters+Colton+October+20%2C+1922&gs;_l=mobile- gws- serp.12...4150.5560.0.6343.2.2.0.0.0.0.237.439.2-2.2.0....0...1c.1j2.64.mobile- gws-serp..0.0.0....0.JUyo72rTNGQ â€“ September 25, 2018) was an American politician. She was born in Asheville, North Carolina. She represented the 51st district in the North Carolina House of Representatives from 1978 to 1994 as a Democrat. Colton died at a retirement center in Asheville from congestive heart failure on September 25, 2018, aged 95.Former North Carolina Legislative Leader Colton Dies at 95 ==References== ==Other websites== * Inventory of the Marie Watters Colton Scrapbooks and Audiocassette, 1978-1994, in the Southern Historical Collection, UNC-Chapel Hill. * Southern Oral History Program Interviews with Marie Watters Colton: North Carolina Politics, October 23, 1995; Southern Women: Women's Leadership and Activism, November 24, 1994 Category:1922 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Politicians from North Carolina Category:People from Asheville, North Carolina Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Marie Colton
